item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 3, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. If you need the money, don't take the job (91 points | 63 comments)

3. Unix core utilities implemented in Haskell (61 points | 10 comments)
4. Speed, scale and reliability: 25 years of Google datacenter networking evolution (142 points | 23 comments)

6. The motor turns too much (320 points | 144 comments)

14. Intel might be too big to fail – policymakers discussing potential solutions (6 points | 2 comments)
15. Show HN: A minimalist (brutalist?) website for sharing all your links (248 points | 135 comments)

21. Prisma Postgres – Runs on bare metal and unikernels (248 points | 113 comments)
22. Repeatability: As Difficult as it is Important (30 points | 7 comments)
23. Boston Dynamics robot Atlas goes hands on [video] (195 points | 171 comments)
24. Colorado scrambles to change voting-system passwords after accidental leak (185 points | 440 comments)
25. Cramming Solitaire onto a Nintendo E-Reader card (96 points | 39 comments)
26. Signal: Online MIDI Editor (142 points | 21 comments)
27. Cash: A small jQuery alternative for modern browsers (166 points | 137 comments)
28. Inspecting North Korea's Digital Map App: Licensing and API Insights (55 points | 22 comments)
29. Security flaws found in all Nvidia GeForce GPUs. Update drivers ASAP (169 points | 106 comments)
